title: Introduction and Legal Duties
objectives: Explain the legal responsibilities of food handlers and supervisors
Describe how enforcement officers inspect and rate food businesses
Identify the core pillars of a compliant food safety management system

title: Food Hazards
objectives: Differentiate between biological, chemical and physical hazards
Recognise common sources of contamination in hospitality venues
Prioritise hazards based on likelihood and severity

title: Contamination and Allergens
objectives: Outline how cross-contamination happens in kitchens
List the 14 regulated allergens and typical menu risks
Plan controls to keep allergen information accurate

title: Personal Hygiene
objectives: Reinforce best practice for hand washing and protective clothing
State when staff must report illness or stay away from food prep
Maintain personal presentation standards that reassure auditors

title: Temperature Control and Storage
objectives: Recall safe cooking, hot holding and cooling temperatures
Explain how the danger zone accelerates bacterial growth
Organise chilled storage to protect high-risk foods

title: Cleaning, Waste, Pests
objectives: Structure two-stage cleaning and disinfection routines
Dispose of waste safely to deter pests
Spot early signs of pest activity and escalate quickly

title: Premises and Equipment
objectives: Assess how layout and maintenance affect food safety
Protect equipment from damage and contamination
Document daily and periodic site checks

title: FSMS, Records, Inspections
objectives: Summarise how HACCP keeps processes safe
Keep training and monitoring records audit-ready
Prepare for routine inspections with confidence
